questions.question: I want to know why …………………. late.
questions.description: In indirect questions, the subject goes before the auxiliary verb.

questions.question: If you had asked me I …………………… you.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: She would have come if you ………………………. her.
questions.description: In the third conditional, we use a past perfect tense in the if-clause and would have + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: The more you praise him, ……………………. he becomes.
questions.description: In this structure, we need the + comparative in both clauses.

questions.question: No sooner had the teacher entered the class …………………….. the students stood up.
questions.description: Sooner is a comparative word use than after it.

questions.question: Would you mind …………………….. me your book?
questions.description: The ing form is used after do you mind and would you mind.

questions.question: He enjoys ……………………. with children.
questions.description: Enjoy cannot be followed by a to-infinitive.

questions.question: He accused me …………………… stealing his watch.
He congratulated me ……………………… my success.
questions.description: Both for and on can be used.

questions.question: He was acquitted …………………… the charges levelled against him.
…………………….. the bell rang, the students rushed to the class.
